body_html:
I have downloaded the master version from github just like @manucarbonell did. I am using a virtualenv called tf. If I don't activate the tf I keep on getting the original error. If I activate tf I get the following. Please advice.

(tf)Carloss-MacBook-Pro:~ Carlos$ python ~/../../Volumes/Transcend/Dropbox/workspace/TensorFlow/CIFAR10/tensorflow-master-tensorflow-models-image-cifar10/cifar10_train.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/Users/Carlos/../../Volumes/Transcend/Dropbox/workspace/TensorFlow/CIFAR10/tensorflow-master-tensorflow-models-image-cifar10/cifar10_train.py", line 43, in
import tensorflow.python.platform
File "/Users/Carlos/.virtualenvs/tf/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/init.py", line 23, in
from tensorflow.python import *
File "/Users/Carlos/.virtualenvs/tf/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/init.py", line 43, in
raise ImportError(msg)
ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/Users/Carlos/.virtualenvs/tf/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/init.py", line 37, in
from tensorflow.core.framework.graph_pb2 import *
ImportError: No module named core.framework.graph_pb2

Error importing tensorflow. Unless you are using bazel,
you should not try to import tensorflow from its source directory;
please exit the tensorflow source tree, and relaunch your python interpreter
from there.

body:
I have downloaded the master version from github just like @manucarbonell did. I am using a virtualenv called tf. If I don't activate the tf I keep on getting the original error. If I activate tf I get the following. Please advice.

(tf)Carloss-MacBook-Pro:~ Carlos$ python ~/../../Volumes/Transcend/Dropbox/workspace/TensorFlow/CIFAR10/tensorflow-master-tensorflow-models-image-cifar10/cifar10_train.py 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/Carlos/../../Volumes/Transcend/Dropbox/workspace/TensorFlow/CIFAR10/tensorflow-master-tensorflow-models-image-cifar10/cifar10_train.py", line 43, in <module>
    import tensorflow.python.platform
  File "/Users/Carlos/.virtualenvs/tf/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/**init**.py", line 23, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import *
  File "/Users/Carlos/.virtualenvs/tf/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/**init**.py", line 43, in <module>
    raise ImportError(msg)
ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/Carlos/.virtualenvs/tf/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/**init**.py", line 37, in <module>
    from tensorflow.core.framework.graph_pb2 import *
ImportError: No module named core.framework.graph_pb2

Error importing tensorflow.  Unless you are using bazel,
you should not try to import tensorflow from its source directory;
please exit the tensorflow source tree, and relaunch your python interpreter
from there.
